title: Erin Go Bragh
text:
Well Happy Saint Patrick's Day! For those not Irish the title is a greeting, a slogan, to basically place allegiance with Ireland, "Forever Ireland." 

Now in this day we do not need to wonder if we are Irish or English, Catholic or Protestant actually. I think your grandmother would smack you across the head if you where not being thankful for the day and the blessings that have befallen you. Same time your grandfather would be handing you a good whiskey or stout saying "Ya, sure be blessed, drink up!" and everyone laughing. 

But really you have to start the day thanking the Saints and happy for life and what has brought you to this place and time. Drinking just seemed to naturally go there, with also fabulous food would be cooked everywhere. Simple joys of the day. And that is ALL the day is to be.

Yes I am Irish, partly. But I was raised part real Irish with the cute antidotes to life, that actually do mean something you find out later as are beaten into your head through life. lol. Also beaten in I am at best to get things done in AM, then required to cancel the day for respects and family. 

Well I have no family around here, and did my respects, praises, and thanking the Lord like a good Irish girl should this AM. I have a deadline and should be working.... but here I am, and I have not worked today as has been beaten into me. 

What is missing is the bagpipes that after one song we all leave the bar and stand outside, across the street, so damn we can hear. lol. We stand around laughing eating some stew, drinking. 

Missing is the waking in the AM to bagpipes over the river and on a hill so doesn't make you fall out of bed when starts playing, and quite frankly that walk is your Uncles only exercise... that and walking to the pub. lol. 

You hear the bagpipes and you are programed it is either Sunday or Saint Pat's but regardless you are to thank the Lord, or thank the Saints, for all you have even if you have nothing, as you always truly have something to praise and be thankful for. Yep... that was a fabulous thing to have beat into your head. 

So I thanked the Lord, thanked the Saint's, and while am not anything other than a Christian, I have unwavering faith whether St Pat's or not, and I seem to have to give this day to the Saint's as it is soooo inbred in me. lol. I am going to enjoy doing nothing, as I programed to do so and like it!

I have been blessed to be a beautiful combination of light brown hair, red and blonde highlights, so people think it is red, brown, blonde depending if weathered by sun or sea. lately it seems strawberry. lol. My Grandmother had that beat ORANGE fire hair.....THANK GOD I did not get that. lol. See praises right there! 

I am also the nice height of 5' 8", and HWP, as who the heck is really perfect as I certainly am not, and I rather like my body looking like a proper girl even with some curves. Wow.... more to be thankful for! 

I am damn witty, introspective, spontaneous, intelligent, and can speak my mind whether drunk and fallen off my chair, or completely engrossed in crap I hate doing. Haven't actually had a good Irish gathering with at least someone handing you down your drink if you fall. lol. Maybe I need that...

I miss and remember when little having to chase and search for Leprechauns... yes, of course they exist! Bite your tongue! But damn I would think I found one, as I heard them in the other room, and all that was left was this fine green dust. lol. Darn maybe next year. Sooooo cute when little, but again it was the onward hope to fulfill your wishes was the underlying lesson, still valid today.

Well I am not pub crawling as haven't lived in a good town that has a good one in many years. I am not even drinking as getting in shape more so this month. MORE to be praising for, as love feeling healthy and blessed with good health, so all good not drinking. 

I will however have to search for a green Leprechaun, grab him, and make my wishes come true. Ok... if I was drinking it would be a guy in green who would say "sure lovey I can make some wishes come true." But heck... that is what age does, keeps the traditions, just changes them around. lol.

So hey thanks for coming down memory lane with me all you who are not Irish, that is what it is, was, and still is apart of EVERY Irish person whether raised that way or not. We Irish are an easy lot, and just wear the green and we love you for today. Everyone should be so lucky right?

So may the road rise up to meet you in your travels, as the sun sure is ALWAYS on your back here in LA. lol. Ever get the inkling to maybe walk a little together let me know.
